Di IASC na fu get na bleem fu wa rait in da chransileeshan, ar if notn na chransileet gud ar na cheenj op rait. Di fos stoorii wa rait in Ingglish “Inter-Agency Standing Committee. My Hero is You: How Kids Can Fight COVID-19!” wa ga di laisn: CC BY-NC-SA 3.0 IGO a go bi di reel reel wan.”

translation.en: Sara’s mum is her hero because she is the best mum and the best scientist in the world. Buteven Sara’s mum cannot find a cure for the coronavirus.
translation.creole: Seera moda a shi Staar Gyal kaaz shi a di bes moda an di bes saiyantis in di worl. Bot na iivn Seera moda kyaahn fain wahn remidi fu di koroonavairos.

translation.en: “What does COVID-19 look like?” Sara asked her mum.
translation.creole: Seera aks shi moda se, “Wa di koroonavairos luk laik?”

translation.en: “COVID-19, or the coronavirus, is so tiny we can’t see it,” said her mum. “But it spreads in the coughs and sneezes of people who are sick, and when they touch people or things around them. People who are sick get a fever and a cough and can have some trouble breathing.”
translation.creole: “Di koroonavairos lil lil so awii kyaahn sii am,” shi moda ansa shi. “Bot it doz spred wen piipl wa sik kaaf ar sniiz, an wen dem toch piipl an toch eniiting wa de rong dem. Piipl wa sik doz get fiiva an kaaf an dem doz get wahn hard taim fu briid iin an briid out eer.”

translation.en: “So we can’t fight it because we can’t see it?”Sara asked.
translation.creole: “So awii kyaahn fait am kaaz awii kyaahn sii am?” Seera aks shi moda.

translation.en: “We can fight it,” said Sara’s mum. “That’s why I need you to be safe, Sara. The virus affects many kinds of people, and everyone can help us fight it. Children are special and they can help too. You need to stay safe for all of us. I need you to be my hero.”
translation.creole: “Awii kyan fait am yes,” Seera moda tel shi. “Da wa mek mi waahn yu staan seef, Seera. Di jormz doz chrobl aal kain a badii, an awii kyan help fu fait am. Piknii speshal an dem kyan help tu. Yu gafu staan seef fu awii. Mi waahn yu fu bii mi Staar Gyal.”

translation.en: Sara laid in bed that night and did not feel like a hero at all. She felt upset. She wanted to go to school but her school was closed. She wanted to see her friends but it was not safe. Sara wanted the coronavirus to stop scaring her world.
translation.creole: Da nait Seera lai dong in shi bed bot shi na fiil laik na Staar Gyal ataal. Shi fiil baad. Shi waahn fu go skuul bot shi skuul klooz. Shi waahn fu sii shi matii dem bot da na seef fu du. Seera waahn di koroonavairus fu stap fraikn piipl aal ova di worl.

translation.en: “Heroes have super powers” she said to herself, closing her eyes to sleep. “What do I have?”
translation.creole: “Dem Staar Gyal ga majik pouwa” shi se tu shiself, wen shi shot shi ai dem fu sliip. “Wa mi ga?”

translation.en: Suddenly a gentle voice whispered her name in the darkness.
translation.creole: Seem taim shi heer wahn lil saaf vais kaal shi neem iizii iizii in di blak a di nait.

translation.en: “Who’s there?” Sara whispered back.
translation.creole: “Huu de de?” Seera ansa bak iizii tu.

translation.en: “What do you need to be a hero, Sara?” the voice asked her.
translation.creole: Di vais aks shi “A wa yu gafu get if yu waahn fu bi wahn Staar Gyal, Seera?

translation.en: “I need a way to tell all the children in the world how to protect themselves so they can protect everyone else...” said Sara.
translation.creole: “Mi waahn wahn wee fu tel aal di piknii dem in di worl hou fu tek keer a deself so dat dem kyan kiip evriibadii els seef…” Seera se.

translation.en: “So what do you need me to be?” the voice asked.
translation.creole: “So a wa yu waahn mi fu bi? di vais aks shi.

translation.en: “I need something that can fly... something with a big voice... and something that can help!”
translation.creole: “Mi waahn wahn ting wa kyan flai… ting wid wahn loud mout… an ting wa kyan help awii!”

translation.en: With a whoosh, something amazing stepped into the moonlight...
translation.creole: Wid wahn wush kaina song, wahn fansii ting kom out in di muunlait…

translation.en: “What are you?” gasped Sara.
translation.creole: Seera hool shi bret an den shi se, “Yu a wa?

translation.en: “I’m Ario,” he said.
translation.creole: “Mi a Ariyo,” di ting se.

translation.en: “I’ve never seen an Ario before,” said Sara.
translation.creole: “Mi neva eva sii wahn Ariyo in mi laif,” Seera se.

translation.en: “Well, I’ve been here all along,” said Ario.
translation.creole: “Wel, mi bin de hee aal di taim,” Ariyo se.

translation.en: “I come from your heart.”
translation.creole: “Mi kom fram insaida yu hart.”

translation.en: “If I have you… then I can tell all thechildren in the world about the coronavirus!”said Sara. “I can be a hero! But wait,Ario, is it safe to travel with the coronavirusaround?”
translation.creole: “If mi ga yu… den mi kyan tel aal di piknii dem in di worl bout di koroonavairos!” Seera se. “Mi kyan bi wahn Staar Gyal! Bot heer na, Ariyo, it seef fu awi chravl wid di koroonavairos aal rong?”

translation.en: “Only with me, Sara,” said Ario. “Nothing can harm you when we are together.”
translation.creole: “Laangz yu de wid mii, Seera,” Ariyo se. “Notn kyaahn chrobl yu wen awii de tugeda.”

translation.en: So Sara jumped on Ario’s back and together they soared out through her bedroom window, into the night sky. They flew towards the stars and said hello to the moon.
translation.creole: So Seera jomp pon Ariyo bak an di tuu a dem flai out shi bejruum winda, in di blak a di nait. Dem flai op tu di star dem an tel di muun hai.

translation.en: As the sun rose, they landed in a lovely desert by pyramids, where a small group of children were playing. The children cried out in joy and waved at Sara and her Ario.
translation.creole: Wen di son staart kom op, dem lan in wahn nais jrai plees wid nof san. De ga som big big bildin we aal di said dem liin tu di midl an jain op in wahn paint a di tap. Wahn lil bit a piknii bin de de a plee. Di piknii dem kaal out pon Seera an Ariyo hapii hapii, an weev dem han tu dem.

translation.en: “Welcome, I am Salem!” cried one of the boys. “What are you doing here? Sorry, we can’t come closer, we have to stay at least one metre away!”
translation.creole: “Awii glaad ayo kom, mi neem Seelem!” wan a di bai dem kaal out. “Wa ayo a du hee? Sari, awii kyaahn staan op tuu neer ayo, awii gafu staan moo dan chrii fut fram ayo!”

translation.en: “That’s why we’re here!” Sara called back. “I’m Sara and this is Ario. Did you knowthat children can keep their neighbours,friends, parents and grandparents safe from the coronavirus? We all need to…”
translation.creole: “Da a wa mek awii kom hee!” Seera ansa bak. “Mi neem Seera an da a Ariyo. Ayo noo se piknii kyan kiip dem neeba dem, dem matii dem, dem moda an faada an dem gramaa an grampaa seef, mek koroonavairos kyaahn kech dem? Awii gafu…”

translation.en:
“Wash our hands with soap and water!”said Salem with a smile. “We know, Sara.
We also cough into our elbows if we’resick - and we wave to people instead of shaking hands. We try to stay inside, but we live in a very crowded city… not everybody is staying home.”
translation.creole: “Wash awii han wid soop an waata!” Seelem se, a skin hii tiit. “Awii noo da, Seera. Awii doz put awii mout in awii elboo an kaaf if awii sik – an awii doz weev tu piipl bot awii naa sheek dem han. Awii doz chrai hard fu staan a hous, bot da tong we awii liv ga nof nof piipl … na aal badii a staan hoom.”

translation.en: “Hmm, maybe I can help with that,” saidArio. “They can’t see the coronavirus, but... they can see me! Jump on, butplease sit on both sides of my wings - they are at least one metre apart!”
translation.creole: “Mmh, meebii mi kyan help ayo wid da,” Ariyo se. “Dem kyaahn sii di koroonavairos, bot… dem kyan sii mii! Jomp op, bot mek shuor ayo sidong pon aal tuu said a mi wing dem – mi wing dem bout chrii fut fram wananada.

translation.en: Ario flew into the sky withSalem and Sara on both of his wings. He flew across the city and began to roar and sing! Salem cried out to the children in the streets:
translation.creole: Ariyo flai op in di skai wid Seelem an Seera pon aal tuu a hii wing dem. Hii flai kraas di tong an staat mek som loud naiz laik laiyan, an hii staat sing! Seelem hala out hard tu di piknii dem in di rood, se:

translation.en: “Go, tell your families, we are safer inside! We can take care of each other best by staying home!”
translation.creole: “Ayo galang go tel ayo faamalii da it beta fu ayo staan a ayo hous! Awii kyan tek keer a wananada beta laangz awii staan a awii hous!”

translation.en: People were amazed by what they saw. They waved and agreed to go into their houses.
translation.creole: Di piipl dem lef wid dem mout oopn wen dem sii da. Dem weev an go in dem hous.

translation.en: Ario soared high into the sky. Salem cried out in joy. Up there inthe clouds a plane flewby, and the passengerslooked out at them in awe.
translation.creole: Ariyo flai faar op in di skai. Seelem baal out laik hii hapii hapii. A di tap a di kloud wahn pleen flai paas dem, an di piipl dem luk pon dem wid dem jaa jrap kaaz dem neva sii notn laik da.

translation.en: “People will have to stop travelling soon, at least for now,” said Salem. “They are closing the borders across the world, and we should all stay where we are and with people we love.”
translation.creole: “Jos nou piipl go gafu stap chravl, at liis fu nou nou,” Seelem se. “Aal di konchrii dem in di worl a klooz dong dem barda, so awii mos staan we awii de wid di piipl dem wa awii lov.”

translation.en: “So many things feel like they have changed,” said Sara. “I get scared about it sometimes.”
translation.creole: “It luk laik nof ting cheenj op,” Seera se. “Somtaim mi doz get fraikn.”

translation.en: “It can feel scary and confusing when things are changing, Sara,” said Ario. “When I feel scared, I breathe very slowly - and breathe out fire!”
translation.creole: “Wen tingz a cheenj, it kyan fiil laik nof ting a hapn seem taim, an dat kyan fraikn ayo baad,” Ariyo se. “Wen mi fiil fraikn, mi doz briid iin an briid out eer sloo sloo – an briid out faiya!”

translation.en: Ario blew out a huge fireball!
translation.creole: Ariyo bloo out wahn big baal a faiya!

translation.en: “How do you relax when you feel scared?” Ario asked them.
translation.creole: “Wa ayo doz du fu kaam dong ayoself wen ayo fraikn?” Ariyo aks dem.

translation.en: “I like to think about someone who makes me feel safe,” said Sara.
translation.creole: “Mi laik fu put mi main pon di piipl dem wa doz mek mi fiil seef,” Seera se.

translation.en: “Me too, I think of all the people who help me feel safe, like my grandparents,” said Salem. “I miss them. I can’t give them a hug because I could give them the coronavirus. We usually see them every weekend, but not now because we have to keep them safe.”
translation.creole: “Mi tu, mi doz put mi main pon aal di piipl dem wa doz mek mi fiil seef, laik mi gramaa an mi grampaa,” Seelem se. “Mi mis dem. Mi kyaahn hog op dem kaaz mi kud paas aan di koroonavairos if mi get am. Awii doz sii dem evrii wiiken, bot na nou, kaaz awii gafu kiip dem seef.”

translation.en: “Can you call them?” Sara asked her friend.
translation.creole: “Yu kyaahn kaal dem pon di foon?” Seera aks shi matii dem.

translation.en: “Oh yes!” said Salem. “They call me every day and I tell them about all the things we are doing at home.
translation.creole: “Ye bodee!” Seelem se. “Dem doz kaal mi evrii dee an mi doz tel dem bout aal di ting dem wa awii a du in awii hous.

translation.en: It makes me feel better, and it makes them feel better too.”
translation.creole: It doz mek mi fiil beta, an it doz mek dem fiil beta tu.”

translation.en: “It is normal to miss people we love that we can’t see right now,” said Ario. “It shows how much we care. Would it make you feel better to meet other heroes?”
translation.creole: “Da a naarmal ting fu mis di piipl dem wa awii lov, huu awii kyaahn sii rait nou,” Ariyo se. “Da shoo hou moch awii keer bout dem. Ayo tingk ayo wuda fiil beta if ayo miit op wid som ada Staar Bai an Staar Gyal?”

translation.en: “Yes please!” Sara and Salem cried back.
translation.creole: “Ye bodee!” Seera an Seelem baal out.

translation.en: “Great, my friend Sasha has a very special superpower,” said Ario. “Let’s go!”
translation.creole: “Gud, mi matii Sasha ga wahn speshal majik pouwa,” Ariyo se. “Le awii go!”

translation.en: And so they soared down to earth and landed by a small village. A girl was outside her house picking flowers. When she saw Ario and the children sitting on his wings, she laughed.
translation.creole: So nou dem flai dong pon ort an lan in wahn lil vilij. Wahn gyal piknii bin de out a shi hous a pik flouwa. Shi laaf wen shi sii Ariyo an di piknii dem pon hii wing.

translation.en: “Ario!” she cried. “We have to stay at least one metre apart, so I will throw you a hug! What are you all doing here?”
translation.creole: “Ariyo!” shi kaal out. “Wii gafu staan moor dan chrii fut fram ayo, so mi a go staan op hee an fling wahn hog gi ayo! Wa ayo a du hee?”

translation.en: “I felt your hug when you told me that, Sasha,” said Ario. “I love how we can use words to show we care, and actions too. I wanted my friends to learn about your superpower.”
translation.creole: “Mi fiil yu hog wen yu tel mi da Sasha,”Ariyo ansa shi se. “Mi lov hou awii kyan yuuz word fu shoo hou awii keer, an wa awii du kyan shoo da awii keer tu. Mi bin waahn mi matii dem fu larn bout yu majik pouwa.”

translation.en: “What is my superpower?” said Sasha.
translation.creole: “Wa a mi majik pouwa?” Sasha aks hii.

translation.en: “Since someone in your family got sick, you are staying at home to make sure you don’t share the coronavirus with anyone else,” said Ario.
translation.creole: “Laik hou sombadii in yu faamalii get sik, an yu a staan a yu hous fu mek shoor yu na paas aan di koroonavairos gi nobadii els,” Ariyo se.

translation.en: “Yes, it’s my Dad, and he’s staying in his bedroom until he gets completely better,” said Sasha.
translation.creole: “Yes, a mi faada, an hii a staan a hii bejruum til hii get nof beta an fiil gud gud,” Sasha se.

translation.en: “But it’s not so bad! We play games, cook, spend time in our garden and have meals together. My brothers and I touch our toes and dance. We read books and I can keep learning because sometimes I miss school. Staying home felt weird at first, but now it feels normal.”
translation.creole: “Bot it na so baad! Awii doz plee, kuk fuud, spen taim in awii gyaardn an nyam fuud tugeda. Mi an mi broda dem doz ben an toch awii too dem, an awii doz daans tu. Awii doz riid buk an mi kyan kiip op wid mi skuul wok, kaaz somtaim mi doz mis skuul baad. Fos, it bin fiil schreenj fu staan a mi hous, bot rait nou it fiil aarait.

translation.en: “That’s not always easy, Sasha,” said Ario. “You are finding ways to have fun and get along with your loved ones at home. That makes you my hero!”
translation.creole: “Dat na iizii aal di taim, Sasha,” Ariyo se. “Yu a fain aal kain a wee fu enjai yuself an spen taim a yu hous wid di piipl dem wa yu lov. Dat a wa mek yu mi Staar Gyal!”

translation.en: “Do you ever fight with your family?” asked Salem.
translation.creole: “Yu eva fait wid yu faamalii dem? Seelem aks.

translation.en: “We fight sometimes,” said Sasha. “We have to be extra patient, and extra understanding, and even quicker to say I’m sorry. That is a real superpower, because it can make ourselves and others feel better. I also need a little time alone. I love dancing and singing on my own! And I can call my friends sometimes...”
translation.creole: “Awi doz fait somtaim,” Sasha se. “Awii gafu tek taim wid wananada, an chrai andastan wananada, an se sari kwik kwik. Dat a wahn reel majik pouwa, kaaz it kyan mek awii fiil beta an ada piipl tu. Mi waahn lil taim bai miself tu. Mi lov fu daans an sing bai miself! An mi kyan kaal mi matii dem pon di foon somtaim…”

translation.en: “But, Ario, what about people who are far from home or don’t have a house?” asked Sara.
translation.creole: “Bot Ariyo, wa bout di piipl dem wa de far fram dem hous ar na ga nowe fu liv?” Seera aks hii.

translation.en: “That’s a great question, Sara,” said Ario.
translation.creole: “Da a wahn gud kweshtan, Seera,” Ariyo se.

translation.en: “Let’s go and find out.”
translation.creole: “Le awii go fain out.”

translation.en: And so they said goodbye to Sasha and set off once more. The air grew warmer as they landed on an island surrounded by the sea.
translation.creole: So dem tel Sasha babai an gaan ageen. Bai di taim dem lan pon wahn ailan wid di sii aal rong, di plees bin staat get lil moo hat.

translation.en: There they saw a camp full of people.
translation.creole: A de dem sii wahn plees ful wid nof piipl.

translation.en: One girl saw them and waved from a distance.
translation.creole: Wahn gyal piknii sii dem an weev shi han tu dem fram rait we shi bin.

translation.en: “Hi Ario, I’m so happy to see you again!” she called out. “We are trying to stay at least one metre away, so I’ll talk to you from here. But I’d love to meet your friends! My name is Leila.”
translation.creole: “Wa gayin aan Ariyo, mi glad glad fu sii yu ageen!” shi kaal out. “Awii a chrai fu staan moor dan chrii fut fram eniibadii, so mi a chrai taak tu ayo fram rait hee. Bot mi wuda glad fu miit yu matii dem! Mi neem Liila.”

translation.en: “Hi Leila! I’m Sara, and this is Salem,” Sara called back. “It sounds like you’re trying to protect yourself from the coronavirus. What else are you doing?”
translation.creole: “Wa gayin aan Liila! Mi neem Seera, an hii a Seelem,” Seera kaal out bak. “It song laik yu a chrai fu kiip yuself seef fram di koroonavairos.  Wa els ayo doz du?”

translation.en: “We’re washing our hands with soap and water!” Leila called back.
translation.creole: “Awii doz wash awii han dem wid soop an waata!” Liila baal out bak.

translation.en: “Do you also cough into your elbow?” asked Salem.
translation.creole: “Ayo doz ben ayo han an kaaf in ayo elboo tu?” Seelem aks.

translation.en: “Can you show us how?” Leila called back. So Salem showed them.
translation.creole: “Yu kyan shoo awii hou fu du da?” Liila ansa bak. So Seelem shoo dem hou fu du am.

translation.en: “We are all trying to be brave, but I am worried about something,” said Leila. “Can I talk about it with you? I heard someone got sick and died and it made me very afraid. Is it true people can die from coronavirus?”
translation.creole: “Awii a chrai fu bi breev, bot somting a bada mi”, Liila se. “Mi kyan taak wid ayo bout it? Mi heer piipl doz get sik an dehd an dat mek mi fraikn baad. A chruu piipl kyan dehd fram koroonavairos?”

translation.en: Ario breathed a big sigh and sat down on his enormous bottom.
translation.creole: Ariyo bloo out hard an laang, an sidong pon hii big fat bambam.

translation.en: “Yes, little heroes, it’s strange,” said Ario. “Some people don’t feel sick at all, but some people can be very sick and some might die. That’s why we all have to be especially careful with older people, and those with other illnesses, because they tend to get more sick. Sometimes when we are feeling very afraid, or unsafe, it can help to imagine a safe place in our minds. Would you like to try this with me?”
translation.creole: “Ye, lil Staar Gyal an lil Staar Bai, it schreenj,” Ariyo se. “Som piipl na fiil sik ataal, bot ada piipl doz get sik sik, an som a dem mait dehd. Da a wa mek awii gafu luk out iivn moo fu di piipl dem wa ool, an di wan dem wa ga ada kain a siknis, kaaz dem piipl kud get moor an moor sik. Som a di taim wen awii fraikn baad, ar wen awii na fiil seef, it kyan help if awii tingk bout wahn plees wa seef. Ayo waahn chrai du da wid mi?”

translation.en: They all said yes, and so Ario asked the children to close their eyes and imagine a place where they feel safe.
translation.creole: Aal a dem se yes, an so Ariyo aks dem fu lak dem ai an tingk bout wahn plees we dem fiil seef.

translation.en: “Focus on a memory or a time when you felt safe,” said Ario.
translation.creole: “Tingk bout wahn taim ar pikcha somting wa ayo memba, wen ayo bin fiil laik notn kudna chrobl ayo,” Ariyo se.

translation.en: He then asked them what they could see, what they could feel, and what they could smell in their safe place. He asked if there was anyone special they would like to invite into their safe place and what they might talk about together.
translation.creole: Den hii aks dem wa dem kud sii, an wa dem kud fiil, an wa dem kud smel in dem seef plees. Hii aks dem weda dem ga nobadii speshal huu dem bin waahn fu bring in dem seef plees an wa dem kud taak bout tugeda.

translation.en: “You can go to your safe place whenever you feel sad or afraid,” said Ario. “This is your super power, and you can share it with your friends and family. And remember that I care about you, and many people do. That will help too.”
translation.creole: “Ayo kyan go in ayo seef plees eniitaim ayo fiil baad ar fiil fraikn,” Ariyo se. “Dis a ayo speshal pouwa, an ayo kyan sheer dis wid ayo matii dem an ayo faamalii dem. An memba mi keer bout ayo, an nof moo piipl keer bout ayo. Dat gon help tu.

translation.en: Leila said, “We can all care for each other.”
translation.creole: Liila se “Awii kyan tek keer a wananada.”

translation.en: “That’s right, Leila,” said Ario. “We can care for each other, wherever we are. Would you like to come with us on our last journey?”
translation.creole: “Dat a chruu, Liila,” Ariyo se. “Awi kyan tek keer a wananada, eniiwe awii de. Yu waahn fu kom wid awii fu go a di laas plees we awii a go?

translation.en: Leila decided to travel with Ario and her new friends. Sara was glad Leila joined them because she knew that sometimes we need to support each other. They flew quietly, without words, but Leila knew her new friends cared a lot about her.
translation.creole: Liila mek op shi main fu go wid Ariyo an shi nyuu matii dem. Seera bin glad Liila bina kom wid dem kaaz shi noo dat somtaim awii gafu de de fu wananada. Dem flai kwaiyat kwaiyat, nobadii na se notn, bot Liila bin noo shi nyuu matii dem bin keer bout shi nof nof.

translation.en: Snowy mountains slowly came into view, and Ario landed in a small town. A few children were playing by a stream.
translation.creole: Dem staart fu sii som mongtin wid snoo pon dem, an Ariyo lan in wahn lil tong. Wahn lil bit a piknii bina plee saida wahn lil kriik.

translation.en: “Ario!” one of them cried, waving to him.
translation.creole: “Ariyo!” wan a dem kaal out, an weev hii han tu hii.

translation.en: “Hello, Kim,” said Ario. “Everyone, I wanted you to meet some friends of mine who have had the coronavirus, and got better.”
translation.creole: “Wa gayin aan Kimii,” Ariyo se. “Evriibadii, mi waahn ayo fu miit som a mi matii dem huu bin kech di koroonavairos an get beta nou.”

translation.en: “What was it like?” Salem asked.
translation.creole: “Wa da bin fiil laik?” Seelem aks dem.

translation.en: “I was coughing and felt too hot sometimes. I was also really tired and didn’t want to play for a few days,” said Kim. “But I slept a lot and my family took care of me. Some of our parents and grandparents had to go to hospital. The nurses and doctors were very kind to them, and people in our community helped us at home. After a few weeks, we were okay again.”
translation.creole: “Mi bina kaaf an fiil hat hat hat somtaim. Mi bin taiyad baad tu an mi neva waahn fu plee som a di dee dem,” Kimii se. “Bot mi sliip nof an mi faamalii tek keer a mi. Som a awii moda an faada dem an awii gramaa an grafaada dem bin gafu go a di haspital. Di nors an di dakta chriit dem reelii nais, an som piipl in awii eerya bin kom an help out a awii hous. Afta a kopl wiik awii ton gud ageen.

translation.en: “I’m Kim’s friend,” said one of the other children. “Just because Kim had the coronavirus, we didn’t stop being friends - even though I could not see him. I never stopped caring about him and we’re happy we can play together again!”
translation.creole: “Mi a Kimii matii,” wan a di ada piknii dem se. “Jos kaaz Kimii kech di koroonavairos it na stap awii fram bii hii matii – iivn doo mi kudna sii hii. Mi neva stap keer bout hii an awii glad awii kyan plee wid wananada ageen!”

translation.en: “Sometimes the most important thing we can do as friends is protect each other,” said Ario. “Even if that means staying away from each other for a while.”
translation.creole: “Som a di taim, di bes ting awii kyan du fu awii matii dem a fu tek keer a wananada,” Ariyo se. “Iivn if dat miin awii gafu staan wee fram wananada lil.”

translation.en: “We can do these things for each other,” said Leila.
translation.creole: “Awii kyan du dem ting fu wananada,” Liila se.

translation.en: “And one day, we will all be able to play again and go back to school like we used to,” said Salem.
translation.creole: “An wan dee, awii kyan plee ageen an go bak a skuul jos laik hou awii yuus tu,” Seelem se.

translation.en: It was time to go home, and time for Sara to say goodbye to her new friends. They promised each other that they would never forget their adventure together.
translation.creole: Den a taim fu go bak a dem hous, an taim fu Seera se babai tu shi nyuu matii dem. Dem pramis wananada dat dem naa go faget di plees dem wa dem bin go an di taim wa dem spen tugeda.

translation.en: Sara felt sad that they might not see each other for a while. But she felt better when she remembered what Kim’s friend had said. Just because you can’t see people, it doesn’t mean you stop loving them.
translation.creole: Seera fiil baad dat meebii dem naa go sii wananada fu jos nou. Bot shi fiil beta wen shi memba wa Kimii matii bin se. Jos kaaz yu kyaahn sii piipl, da na miin yu doz stap lov dem.

translation.en: Ario dropped them all back to their homes, and waited for Sara to fall asleep before he left.
translation.creole: Ariyo jrap aaf bak aal a dem a dem hous, an weet fu Seera fu jrap asliip bifoor hii lef.

translation.en: “Can we do the same tomorrow?” Sara asked him.
translation.creole: “Wi kyan du di seem ting tumaro?” Seera aks hii.

translation.en: “No Sara, it’s time for you to be with your family now,” said Ario. “Remember our story. You can keep those you love safe by washing your hands and staying home. I am never far away. You can always be with me when you go to your safe place.”
translation.creole: “Naa Seera, a taim fu yu staan wid yu faamalii nou,” Ariyo se. “Memba awii stoorii. Yu kyan kiip di piipl dem wa yu lov seef if yu wash yu han an staan a yu hous. Mi na de far fram yu. Yu kyan bi wid mi aal di taim wen yu go in yu seef plees.”

translation.en: “You are my hero,” she whispered.
translation.creole: “Yu a mi Staar Bai,” shi tel hii iizii iizii.

translation.en: “You are my hero too, Sara. You are a hero to all those who love you,” he said.
translation.creole: “Yu a mi Staar Gyal tu Seera. Yu a wahn Staar Gyal fu evriibadii wa lov yu,” hii se.

translation.en: Sara fell asleep and when she woke the next day, Ario was gone. So she went to her safe place to talk to him, then drew everything they had seen and learnt on their adventure. She ran to her mum with her drawing to tell her the news.
translation.creole: Seera jrap asliip an wen shi week op di neks dee, Ariyo bin gaan. So shi go in shi seef plees fu go taak wid hii, den shi jraa aal a di ting dem wa dem bin sii an wa dem bin larn wen dem bina go aal bout di plees. Shi ron go shoo shi moda wa shi jraa an tel shi di hool stoorii.

translation.en: “We can all help people be safe, Mum,” she said. “I met so many heroes on my adventure!”
translation.creole: “Awii kyan help evriibadii fu staan seef, Maamii,” shi se tu shi moda. “Mi miit op wid somoch Staar Gyal and Staar Bai wen mi bin go aal rong di plees!”

translation.en: “Oh Sara, you are right!” said her mum. “There are many heroes keeping people safe from the coronavirus, like wonderful doctors and nurses. But you remind me that we can all be heroes, every day, and my biggest hero is you.”
translation.creole: “Seera gyal, yu rait bout da!” shi moda se. “Dem ga nof nof  Staar Gyal an Staar Bai bout di plees fu kiip di piipl dem seef fram di koroonavairos, laik di nais nais dakta an nors dem. Bot yu mek mi memba se awii kyan bii Staar Gyal an Staar Bai tu, evrii dee, an mi biges Staar Gyal a yu!”

translation.en: All the veins become tied together, and get fat! Sometimes -sometimes if he is my partner, he would work, sometimes he would come over, and rub, and rub, and try to pull it, and pull, and pull, you know? Pull and rub and pull. Don't let me tell vou what vou have to do - whoever is muscle-bound. Your stomach or your liver wants to burst out, with pain, you know, while he is doing these kinds of things.
translation.creole: aal di veen kom an tai tugeda, an kom fat so! sodaim - sodaim if hii a mi pardno, ii a wok, sotai ii kom, i gu rob, in gu rob, ii gu rob, igu chrai pul, ii gu pul, ii gu pul, yu noo? Pul an rob an pul. No le mi tel yu wo yuu ga to duu - wo gat di mosl bong. Yu stomik or yoor livo waan bos out, wid peen, yu noo, wails hi gu duu dis kain o tingsz.
